sn35.236:0.3: 236. The Simile of Hands and Feet (1st)
sn35.236:1.1: “Mendicants, when there are hands, picking up and putting down are found.
sn35.236:1.2: When there are feet, coming and going are found.
sn35.236:1.3: When there are joints, contracting and extending are found.
sn35.236:1.4: When there’s a belly, hunger and thirst are found.
sn35.236:1.5: In the same way, when there’s an eye, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.236:1.6: When there’s an ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.236:1.7: mind, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by mind contact.
sn35.236:2.1: When there are no hands, picking up and putting down aren’t found.
sn35.236:2.2: When there are no feet, coming and going aren’t found.
sn35.236:2.3: When there are no joints, contracting and extending aren’t found.
sn35.236:2.4: When there’s no belly, hunger and thirst aren’t found.
sn35.236:2.5: In the same way, when there’s no eye, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.236:2.6: When there’s no ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.236:2.7: mind, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by mind contact.”
